intro: Marlierea strigipes, commonly known as the hairy marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Marlierea strigipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
